hypothesis: Early polish iterations don't need full accuracy. Using 60% timesteps for iterations 1-4 and 100% for iterations 5-8 may save time while preserving accuracy.
result: ABORTED - Prior experiment showed truncated polish HURTS accuracy significantly

prior_evidence.finding: NM polish on truncated (40%) timesteps HURTS: score 1.1342 vs 1.1688 with full polish (-0.0346)
prior_evidence.implication: 60% timesteps for early polish would likely also hurt accuracy, though less severely

key_findings: NM polish requires full timesteps for accurate refinement
The truncated signal is a proxy; polishing the proxy overfits to noise
Progressive fidelity would likely hurt accuracy more than it saves time
Implementation complexity high: requires modifying optimizer for multi-phase polish
